lead_paragraph: The national court ordered the extradition to the United States of Jesús Ángel Bergantiños Díaz, accused in a major art market scandal that involved the sale of nearly $70 million in forged paintings through a New York gallery.

headline.print_headline: Spaniard to Face U.S. Trial in Art Scandal
headline.main: Spaniard to Face U.S. Trial in Art Scandal

snippet: The national court ordered the extradition to the United States of Jesús Ángel Bergantiños Díaz, accused in a major art market scandal that involved the sale of nearly $70 million in forged paintings through a New York gallery.
abstract: Spanish national court orders Jesus Angel Bergantinos Diaz, businessman accused of involvement in art forgery scandal, extradited to United States; Diaz is charged with helping orchestrate sale of nearly $70 million in forged paintings through New York-based Knoedler & Company.
